00040 #ifndef _uiscreen_h
00041 #define _uiscreen_h
00042 
00043 #include "crossplatformexport.h"
00044 #include "datatypes.h"
00045 
00046 #include <map>
00047 
00048 namespace Gorilla
00049 {
00050     class Screen;
00051     class Layer;
00052 }
00053 
00054 namespace phys
00055 {
00056     class UIManager;
00057     class UILayer;
00058     namespace UI
00059     {
00060         class Button;
00061         class Widget;
00062     }
00063     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00064     /// @class UIScreen
00065     /// @headerfile uiscreen.h
00066     /// @brief This class is a helper class for creating UI's.  It is responsible for storing and keeping
00067     /// track of all the elements of a single UI screen.
00068     /// @details UI's can optionally be divided up into Screens, or "pages".  Each screen is batched together
00069     /// for rendering, so keeping the amount of screens to a minimum will improve performance.
00070     ///////////////////////////////////////
00071     class PHYS_LIB UIScreen
00072     {
00073         protected:
00074             Gorilla::Screen* GorillaScreen;
00075             UIManager* Manager;
00076             String Name;
00077             std::map<Whole,UILayer*> Layers;
00078         public:
00079             /// @brief Internal constructor
00080             /// @param GScreen The Gorilla Screen this Screen is based on.
00081             /// @param manager Pointer to the manager that created this Screen.
00082             UIScreen(const String& name, Gorilla::Screen* GScreen);
00083             /// @brief Class destructor.
00084             ~UIScreen();
00085             /// @brief Gets the name of this screen.
00086             /// @return Returns a string containing the name of this screen.
00087             String& GetName();
00088             /// @brief Sets the screens visability.
00089             /// @param Visable A bool representing the visability of the screen.
00090             void SetVisible(bool Visible);
00091             /// @brief Gets the screens visability.
00092             /// @return Returns a bool representing the visability of the screen.
00093             bool IsVisible();
00094             /// @brief Forces the screen to be shown.
00095             void Show();
00096             /// @brief Forces the screen to hide.
00097             void Hide();
00098             /// @brief Creates a layer in the GUI screen to place GUI objects in.
00099             /// @details A GUI layer is exactly that, a layer of GUI objects.  You can have multiple GUI
00100             /// layers per screen.  The Zorder of the layer determines it's visability if there are multiple
00101             /// layers.  If the Zorder of one layer is higher then another in the same space, then the Zorder
00102             /// with the higher Zorder will be rendered...giving it the appearance of being on top of the other
00103             /// GUI object or objects.
00104             /// @param Name The name to be given to the layer.
00105             /// @param Zorder The layers Zorder, as explained above.
00106             UILayer* CreateLayer(const String& Name, Whole Zorder);
00107             /// @brief Gets an already created layer by name.
00108             /// @return Returns a pointer to the layer of the specified name.
00109             UILayer* GetLayer(const String& Name);
00110             /// @brief Gets an already created layer by it's index.
00111             /// @return Returns a pointer to the layer at the specified index.
00112             UILayer* GetLayer(Whole Index);
00113             /// @brief Gets an already created layer by it's Zorder.
00114             /// @return Returns a pointer to the layer with the specified Zorder.
00115             UILayer* GetLayerbyZorder(Whole Zorder);
00116             /// @brief Gets the number of layers created and stored in this class.
00117             /// @return Returns the number of layers this class is storing.
00118             Whole GetNumLayers();
00119             /// @brief Destroy's a previously created layer.
00120             /// @param Name The name of the layer to be destroyed.
00121             void DestroyLayer(UILayer* Layer);
00122             /// @brief Gets the button the mouse is over if any.
00123             /// @details This function searches only the visable layers contained in this screen.
00124             /// @return Returns the button the mouse is over, or NULL if there are none.
00125             UI::Button* CheckButtonMouseIsOver();
00126             /// @brief Gets the widget the mouse is over if any.
00127             /// @details This function searches only the visable layers contained in this screen.
00128             /// @return Returns the widget the mouse is over, or NULL if there are none.
00129             UI::Widget* CheckWidgetMouseIsOver();
00130     };//uiscreen
00131 }//phys
00132 
00133 #endif
